creator: rainerlund177

content:
Rainer L said
Hi, how can I remove the old passwords? unfortunately I still can't get in. Danke Rainer

Settings/Privacy & Security, Saved Passwords. After a password is removed, restart TB and enter the new one when prompted and check the box to store it in Saved Passwords.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Holq Prueba reparar la carpeta en cuestión:

1-En el menú de Thunderbird, seleccione Archivo -> Sin conexión -> Trabajar sin conexión. 2-Haga clic derecho en la carpeta que desea reparar y seleccione Propiedades. 3- En la pestaña Información general, haga clic en el botón Reparar carpeta. 4-Clic en OK.

Saludos

content:
This is a thread on the community support forum so it is best not to post personal information like email addresses and such in public.

You are not required to make any donations in order to use the Thunderbird email client. The donations are optional as it helps the Thunderbird developers and community. There is no way for your Thunderbird email client installed on your macOS to know you have donated.

From the FAQ further down on https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/

You can use https://www.thunderbird.net/donate/help/ to ask for refunds if you prefer.
creator: James

content: Open the profile folder from Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, open the account subfolder in Mail (POP accounts) or ImapMail. If you see large files, mbox files, with no extension, e.g. Inbox, there or in sbd subdirectories, copy them to Mail/Local Folders, restart TB, and see if the messages are readable in the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.
creator: sfhowes

content: That is usually an install problem. I suggest downloading and installing over the top of the current installation,

content:
This can be done with css, for cards or table view (see picture): 

/* card bg colour for selected messages */ tr[is="thread-card"].selected .card-container {      color: black !important;      background-color: lightgreen !important;  }  /* row bg colour for selected messages table view*/ tr[is="thread-row"].selected {   color: white !important;   background-color: red !important;  }


Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, create a new folder named chrome, create a new document in chrome with a text editor, name it userChrome.css, Save as type: All files *.*, copy in the above code, change the colours as desired. Double-click toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets to true in Settings/General/Config. editor, restart TB.

Online css generator

video on how to create a css file (Firefox and TB)

content:
The most common reason for these issues is obsolete server settings or not using OAuth2 authentication:

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
creator: sfhowes

content: Yes, you can setup thunderbird on old pc to download messages (POP, I presume). Since POP and IMAP are different, you would need to set up another email account for IMAP, and the two can coexist. However, if you then want to move the POP messages to the IMAP account, it is problematic; not impossible, but needs careful timing, since IMAP wasn't designed for high volume uploads. But people do it all the time. I mention it here only to alert you that it isn't just a matter of dragging messages from one account to another.

content: Apologies all, I found the culprit - a Windows Defender false positive detection of Trojan:Script/Wacatac.B!ml. So Defender removed my inbox file and wouldn't even allow me to restore it. I have now added the TB profile as an exclusion - I did it before for MalwareBytes but forgot to do it for Defender.

content:
Ciao, mi spiace ma stai sbagliando impostazione:

  • Thunderbird è un software gratuito offerto senza garanzie. Per cui non è possibile che tu sia un cliente di Thunderbird o di Mozilla. Se hai un contratto di assistenza con qualche società terza è a loro che devi rivolgerti.
  • Questo è solo un forum per gli utenti dei prodotti Mozilla, non è un supporto tecnico. Se fornisci i dettagli del tuo problema, possiamo provare a darti una mano ma senza garanzie e senza vincoli temporali perché ognuno partecipa quando e se ne ha il tempo.
  • La partecipazione al forum avviene solo attraverso il sito non attraverso mail private ne tanto meno per telefono

Detto questo, se vuoi illustrare meglio il tuo problema prova anzitutto a fornire queste informazioni:

  • gestore della casella email
  • configurazione dell'account (POP3 o IMAP)
  • trascrizione dei messaggi di errore che compaiono quando provi a inviare o ricevere posta
  • versione di Thunderbird e del sistema operativo
  • eventuali antivirus o antimalware

Bonjour,

Thunderbird only has the most recentpassword you gave it. If that isn't working you need a new one. If you wish to see the password, click settings, then privacy&security, then click 'saved passwords' and then 'show passwords' and then highlight one of the account's rows and rightclick to open password.

content: When you delete an account, there is a tickbox on the delete pane to remove data as well. If you did NOT tick that box, the data may still be there. To find out, click help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder', click 'open folder' and then click the Mail account to see if the old POP account is listed and then click the account name to see the data folders.
creator: davidsk

content:
See http://kb.mozillazine.org/Recovering_deleted_mail_accounts

The last paragraph is a bit obsolete. If you don't re-add the account but just need the old mail, copy the mbox files to Mail/Local Folders, while TB is closed.

content: If the account folder only has .msf files but no mbox files with the same name but no extension, e.g. Inbox and Inbox.msf, it means the account was set to download headers only. The mbox files contain the message contents, while the .msf is the folder index. If you have a backup profile or the account is on another PC, it might be possible to recover the mail for the deleted account.

content: Another user had the same issue: the 'normal password' prompt appears even when all MS accounts use OAuth2. The reason is unknown, so I suggest testing with a new profile. Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles, create a new profile, add one account with OAuth2. The current profile is unaffected, and if the new one works, data can be transferred from the old to the new. If you only have the one account with OAuth2 in the new profile, I can't see how the mistaken prompt can appear.
creator: sfhowes

content: TRy changing server to outlook.office365.com and set authentication to Auth2 and try again.

creator: poljos-moz

content: The reports point to possible issues with MalwareBytes and ownCloud. The first might affect attachments if it's scanning the TB profile folder (add the profile as an exception or exclusion), while the second might affect TB if you are syncing with ownCloud online storage. Run Windows in safe mode, which will bypass startup apps, which probably includes MWB and oC, and test TB.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks, sfhowes. There was a new version of the ownCloud client available (v5.3.1.14018). So i installed it and so far the problem is not reoccurring. Time will tell for sure.
